subject: Let’s start over.
description_text:
Attached is my current setup.

Haptics work.

I game however the throttle only does not register 100% throttle.

The pedals are calibrated and dead zoned correctly.

The outlets at 3 prong all the way through.

The control box is grounded directly to the aluminum profile of my rig.

conversations.body_text: Hi David Guidolin,     Could you please provide a video demonstration and share it via Google Drive with access permissions enabled?

Sure thing. When i get home thank you.

On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:24 AM service@simsonn.com

Provided a video with an explanation. Thank you.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1v5zIoeQbT4Y6givz-jeA1jdrbcYNI4Or


On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 10:20 AM David Guidolin <daveygracer@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Sure thing. When i get home thank you.
>
> On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:24 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi David Guidolin,    Which game is this? Have you tested it by setting the throttle deadzone maximum to 5%? In addition, we recommend using the VKB tool to check the signal status.  We also suggest referring to this post and isolating the VAM Pro motor from its mounting bracket using nylon screws and nylon washers to help reduce interference issues.     https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/0551/4739/7238/files/VKB_JoyTester_40fdd530-6057-437e-9b50-3ac2d59dbbcd.zip?v=1693176246      https://www.reddit.com/r/simracing/comments/1n291hi/solution_for_simsonn_vam_pro_emi_issues/

Leman ultimate and it also has issues with other games. When haptics are
not powered into the wall the pedals work normal full range. I am having an
issue with just the throttle pedal. So on your new branded pedals the nut
and washer are nylon? I have the original pedals. Also, the specified
hardware provided for mounting it on the pedals isn’t sufficient?

On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:49 PM service@simsonn.com

Can you provide a kit for me please?

Shipping information.
51 Regent road Toronto Ontario m3k1g8
David Guidolin
16477819329

On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 10:10 PM David Guidolin <daveygracer@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Leman ultimate and it also has issues with other games. When haptics are
> not powered into the wall the pedals work normal full range. I am having an
> issue with just the throttle pedal. So on your new branded pedals the nut
> and washer are nylon? I have the original pedals. Also, the specified
> hardware provided for mounting it on the pedals isn’t sufficient?
>
> On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:49 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi David Guidolin,  To address this issue, for new customers, we provide a free set of nylon screws and washers in addition to the standard metal screws included in the package, ensuring better installation and isolation.
Hi David Guidolin,  Please provide your order number.

I bought the haptics a couple of months ago. You can’t help me out?

On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 10:15 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi David Guidolin,  Please kindly provide your order number, and I will arrange to send you a replacement set of nylon screws and washers.

SSN1644

On Wed, Sep 17, 2025 at 5:44 AM service@simsonn.com

Thank you

On Wed, Sep 17, 2025 at 6:45 AM David Guidolin <daveygracer@gmail.com>
wrote:

> SSN1644
>
> On Wed, Sep 17, 2025 at 5:44 AM service@simsonn.com
Hello, here is your logistics tracking link.  https://t.17track.net/en#nums=YT2526200702059434

Thank you so much!

On Thu, Sep 18, 2025 at 10:02 PM service@simsonn.com

I just received the hardware. Installed the nylon washer that separates the
bolt from the mounting plate and I’m still having the same problem across
all the games.

On Thu, Sep 18, 2025 at 10:16 PM David Guidolin <daveygracer@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Thank you so much!
>
> On Thu, Sep 18, 2025 at 10:02 PM service@simsonn.com

And I tried recalibrating in software and in game setting the max stroke
and minimum and still the same. ?

On Mon, Sep 29, 2025 at 6:49 PM David Guidolin <daveygracer@gmail.com>
wrote:

> I just received the hardware. Installed the nylon washer that separates
> the bolt from the mounting plate and I’m still having the same problem
> across all the games.
>
> On Thu, Sep 18, 2025 at 10:16 PM David Guidolin <daveygracer@gmail.com>
> wrote:
>
>> Thank you so much!
>>
>> On Thu, Sep 18, 2025 at 10:02 PM service@simsonn.com

Good news, I wasn’t really given any instruction, however the nylon between
the motor and the mounting plate is the key. It works now. Thank you for
supplying the materials. My sim is complete!
